page.title: 14VILLAGE LIFE IN 1915 PART 1
page.content: MOST FARMWORKERS LIVED IN TIED COTTAGES,WHICH WERE LET RENT FREE.THE WORKERS RECEIVED A LOW WAGE ABOUT 15 SHILLINGS/WEEK.IF HE WAS ILL,NO RENT WAS COLLECTED.THEIR HOMES HAD NO WATER OR ELECTRICITY.LIGHTING WAS BY CANDLES OR OIL-LAMPS.WATER WAS BROUGHT FROM THE RIVER OR THE WELL IN THE YARD.DURING DROUGHTS WATER WAS BOUGHT FROM A CERTAIN WELL AT 1/2PENCE A BUCKET.THE HOUSES HAD NO BATHROOM.A BOWL AND JUG WERE IN THE BEDROOM FOR DAILY WASHING.A TIN BATH WAS PLACED IN FRONT OF THE FIRE ONCE A WEEK FOR THE FAMILY BATH.FAMILIES WERE USUALLY MUCH LARGER AND POORER.A PAIR OF BOOTS LASTED A YEAR.BOYS HAD 2 PAIRS OF TROUSERS AND GIRLS 2 DRESSES:1 TO WEAR AND 1 IN THE WASH.MOST FAMILIES FATTENED UP A PIG.KILLING DAY WAS A BIG OCCASION,PIECES OF THE PIG WERE SENT ROUND TO THE NEIGHBOURS.
